feed.title: Penter Lab
feed.subtitle: Understanding cancer and immune cell interactions using large-scale single cell genomics approaches.

entry.title: paper on extramedullary AML published!
entry.content:
Immune mechanisms that associate with extramedullary AML revealed by single cell RNA sequencing. Finally published in Blood.

Mechanisms of immune escape and extramedullary tropism in leukemia cutis
Livius Penter, Katie Maurer, Nicoletta Cieri, Wesley Lu, Haoxiang Lyu, ..., Pavan Bachireddy, Matthew S. Davids, Jacqueline S. Garcia, Robert J. Soiffer, Catherine J Wu
Blood Journal   ·   30 Sep 2025   ·   doi:10.1182/blood.2025029121
immune mechanisms in extramedullary AML
AML single cell genomics immunotherapy
entry.summary: Immune mechanisms that associate with extramedullary AML revealed by single cell RNA sequencing. Finally published in Blood.

entry.title: Henry joining
entry.summary: Henry Tietz has joined us - welcome! :)

entry.title: Jonas publishes in Blood Cancer Discovery

link.title: Jonas publishes in Blood Cancer Discovery

entry.content:
Jonas has published a nice editorial on BoneMarrowMap in Blood Cancer Discovery. Congratulations!

Putting AML Differentiation States on the BoneMarrowMap
Jonas Berger, Livius Penter
Blood Cancer Discovery   ·   28 Apr 2025   ·   doi:10.1158/2643-3230.BCD-25-0083
Editorial on BoneMarrowMap
AML single cell genomics
entry.summary: Jonas has published a nice editorial on BoneMarrowMap in Blood Cancer Discovery. Congratulations!

entry.title: Tim starting!
entry.content:
Tim Berneiser has started his work as PhD student funded through TARGET-MPN. He has a great background in wet and dry lab approaches, including internships in single cell genomics at the Berlin Institute for Medical Systems Biology (MDC-BIMSB). Tim will interrogate the genetics and transcriptomics of MPN in a longitudinal fashion and collaborate closely with Prof. Lars Bullinger’s group.

Welcome Tim!
entry.summary: Tim Berneiser has started his work as PhD student funded through TARGET-MPN. He has a great background in wet and dry lab approaches, including internships in single cell genomics at the Berlin Institute for Medical Systems Biology (MDC-BIMSB). Tim will interrogate the genetics and transcriptomics of MPN in a longitudinal fashion and collaborate closely with Prof. Lars Bullinger’s group.

entry.title: Yeqin starting!
entry.content:
Yeqin Sha has started his work as self-funded PhD student. He has a strong background in bioinformatics and hematology, which will add valuable expertise to the group.

We are excited to have you Yeqin!
entry.summary: Yeqin Sha has started his work as self-funded PhD student. He has a strong background in bioinformatics and hematology, which will add valuable expertise to the group.

entry.title: Priyanka starting!
entry.content:
Priyanka Venkatesh has started her work funded by the John Hansen Research grant from DKMS to explore the phenotypes of measurable residual disease (MRD) after allogeneic stem cell transplantation. With her background in dry and wet lab, she is bringing in all the skills needed for this challenging project.

Good luck Priyanka!
entry.summary: Priyanka Venkatesh has started her work funded by the John Hansen Research grant from DKMS to explore the phenotypes of measurable residual disease (MRD) after allogeneic stem cell transplantation. With her background in dry and wet lab, she is bringing in all the skills needed for this challenging project.

entry.title: Publication: Coevolution of mitochondrial and somatic nuclear DNA mutations.

link.title: Publication: Coevolution of mitochondrial and somatic nuclear DNA mutations.

entry.content:
A satisfying conclusion to a side-story that became a major project of Livius’ postdoc with Cathy Wu.

[no title info]
[no author info]
[no publisher info]   ·   [no date info]   ·   [no id info]

We show co-evolution of mitochondrial and somatic nuclear DNA mutations using various approaches including reanalysis of bulk RNA and WES-seq data, single cell DNA sequencing and ASAP-seq. Further, we use maternal mitochondrial DNA variants to track rare donor or recipient-derived single cells following allogeneic stem cell transplantation to map out microchimeric states, such as residual leukemia at incipient relapse or remaining donor-derived hematopoiesis at time of frank hematologic recurrence.
entry.summary: A satisfying conclusion to a side-story that became a major project of Livius’ postdoc with Cathy Wu.

entry.title: Seunghoon starting!
entry.content:
Seunghoon Kim, PhD has started his work as shared postdoctoral research fellow between Dr. med. Jana Ihlow and Prof. Sandrine Sander. We are happy to provide the scientific environment in which he will develop his single cell genomics research projects.

Best of luck to you Seunghoon!
entry.summary: Seunghoon Kim, PhD has started his work as shared postdoctoral research fellow between Dr. med. Jana Ihlow and Prof. Sandrine Sander. We are happy to provide the scientific environment in which he will develop his single cell genomics research projects.

entry.title: Mischa starting!
entry.content:
Dr. Mischa Selig has started his work as postdoctoral research fellow with us - we are very thrilled to have him and wish him all the best of luck for his projects.

Bring it on, Mischa!
entry.summary: Dr. Mischa Selig has started his work as postdoctoral research fellow with us - we are very thrilled to have him and wish him all the best of luck for his projects.

entry.title: PhD position available!

We have an opening for a PhD position.

Please consider applying! :)
